meanings.definition: A person who avoids paying debts or bills.
meanings.sent1: The deadbeats never returned the money they borrowed.
meanings.sent2: The landlord had trouble collecting rent from the deadbeats in the building.
meanings.sent3: The deadbeats at the restaurant tried to sneak out without paying their bill.
meanings.sent4: The deadbeats were like shadows, always disappearing when it was time to settle debts.
meanings.sent5: The image of the deadbeats running away with pockets full of money was etched in his mind.

meanings.sent1: My brother is such a deadbeat, always lounging around and never helping out.
meanings.sent2: The company had to let go of the deadbeat employee who never completed tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The deadbeat student slept through all his classes and never turned in assignments.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a deadbeat, watching TV all day instead of doing her chores.
meanings.sent5: The deadbeat's room was a mess, with clothes and trash scattered everywhere.
